seamonsters.modularRobot¶

class seamonsters.modularRobot.Module(initSuper=True)[source]¶

Bases: wpilib.iterativerobot.IterativeRobot

An IterativeRobot that is able to contain other robots. If you subclass this and override __init__ or special robot functions like robotInit or teleopPeriodic, make sure you call super()’s versions of those functions.

__init__(initSuper=True)[source]¶
addModule(robot)[source]¶

Add a sub-robot to use in the robot. When special robot functions like robotInit or teleopPeriodic are called, they will also be called for each sub-robot. If the robot happens to be a Module, its parent will be set.

autonomousInit()[source]¶
autonomousPeriodic()[source]¶
disabledInit()[source]¶
disabledPeriodic()[source]¶
getModule(moduleType)[source]¶

Find a sub-Module given its class.

parent()[source]¶

Get the Module that owns this Module

robotInit()[source]¶
runModules(function)[source]¶

Internal function to apply a given function to each module

setParent(parent)[source]¶

Internal function to set the parent Module of this Module

time()[source]¶

Get the number of iterations since the start of the disabled, autonomous, teleop, or test loop.
